result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Lightner-Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $1,454.09 to City Bank.  Restitution to be held open for 30 days to determine if there is other restitution owed

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or undergo a course of education that is full-time
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def to undergo Psychological Evaluation before getting discharged from the jail, and follow through with any recommendations
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

NO Contact with users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Def to work on treatment plan

Complete Behavioral Health assessment and follow-through with recommendations

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

superMiscConds.notes:
No controlled substances without a valid prescription with random testing.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Make payments on any unpaid financial obligations.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

1:17 Been spending a lot of time at home.  Thinking for a Change tomorrow.  When I am bored my thoughts go to being high and getting in trouble.  I keep my mind away from the bad thoughts. 11:52 am Def in court w/ Atty Thomas F. Locante.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.  He's been accepted into drug court.

13CF-812
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds   Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

13CF-812  Count 2 - Receiving Stolen Property as a Repeater (Fel)  943.34(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a)  GUILTY   Counts 1, 3 & 4  Dismissed but read-in
14CF-97    Count 1 - Burglary (Fel)  943.10 and 939.50    Counts 2-10  Dismissed but read-in
13CM-230  Count 3 - Bail Jumping (fta) as a repeater  946.49(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a)   GUILTY    Counts 1 & 2  Dismissed but read-in
13CM-1055  Count 1 - Attempted Retail Theft  943.50(1m)(b) and 939.51(3)(a)   GUILTY   Count 2 - Obstructing an Offider  946.41(1) and 939.51(3)(a)  GUILTY  Count 3 - Bail Jumping (new crime)  946.49(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a)   GUILTY
13CM-61, 13CM-762 and 13CM-1679  Dismissed but read-in

Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No promises/threats.  Lightner-Raymond states what he did.

COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted in all cases except 14CF-97.  14CF-97 is subject to a Diversion, 
held open, and continued to the conclusion of the drug court program.  Set for review in 3 years when probation ends.

Skemp comments.  He completed a program at Hazelton.  I do think that drug court can benefit him.  Asks for a drug court hold until we see him in drug court and he has stable housing.  Locante doesn't disagree with Ms. Skemp's comments.  Asks the court to go along with the recommendations.  Lightner-Raymond comments.  Court comments and addresses Mr. Lightner-Raymond

SENTENCES:
13CM-1055 - 157 days CJ w/ 157 days credit - time served
Sentence withheld on each count in 13CF-812, 13CM-230
3 years probation on each count - concurrent
Comply with any counceling or assessments as PO deems appropriate
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr.
Random testing
Restitution as set out in the Statement as to Negotiated Plea - apply cash bonds; individuals to receive restitution prior to businesses and then businesses to get restitution prior to banks
No contact with those as set out in the Statement as to Negotiated Plea
No contact with known drug users or drug dealers
Letters of apology to the victims
Complete the drug court program and comply with all its terms and conditions
